snippet: Local authorities from New York City to Maine were preparing Thursday for what forecasters said could be the heaviest snowfall to hit some cities in the Northeast in a century.
abstract: Local authorities from New York City to Maine prepare for what forecasters say could be the heaviest snowfall to hit some cities in the Northeast in a century; airlines announce suspension of flights and Amtrak suspends service between New York and Boston.

byline.contributor: Jess Bidgood and Katharine Q. Seelye contributed reporting from Boston.

lead_paragraph: Local authorities from New York City to Maine were preparing Thursday for what forecasters said could be the heaviest snowfall to hit some cities in the Northeast in a century.

headline.seo: Northeast Could Be Hit With Major Snowstorm
headline.main: Flights and Trains Canceled as Storm Heads to Northeast
headline.print_headline: Flights and Trains Canceled as Storm Heads to Northeast
